doc.field: This was take at Cabrillo National Monument on Point Loma in San Diego, California. This time of year the fog is very prevalent along our coast and even has a name...."June Gloom". The air temperature when I took this was probably 65 - 70 degrees F. The water temperature is about 63 degrees, but fifty miles east of here, in our deserts, the air temperature is over 100 degrees. This differential causes winds from the ocean and cool temperatures along the coast. The result is that it's wonderful to live close to the coast in the summer, if you like cooler weather. My daughter spent one summer living in Carlsbad, and said she never saw the sun. <a href"http:bighugelabs.comonblack.php?id4702099004&sizelarge" rel"nofollow">View Large On Black<a>

Taken at Cabrillo National Monument in San Diego, California. In January 2009 I purchased a Nikon D50 camera which has been modified for infrared photography. The camera has had the internal infrared blocking filter replaced with an infrared filter. The camera cannot be used for color photography. Here is the web site of Jim Chen who modifies and sells these cameras. <a href"http:www.jimchenphoto.com" rel"nofollow">www.jimchenphoto.com<a> If you're interested in infrared photography, please visit my infrared set <a href"http:www.flickr.comphotos9422878@N08sets72157600507865146">www.flickr.comphotos9422878@N08sets72157600507865146<a> Other pictures I have taken here over the years can be seen in my "Old Point Loma Lighthouse set. <a href"http:www.flickr.comphotos9422878@N08sets72157628026531823">www.flickr.comphotos9422878@N08sets72157628026531823<a> Awards

I went to Cabrillo National Monument today with the San Diego Photography Collective, which is a meetup group. The park was celebrating the 156th anniversary of the first use of the lighthouse back in 1855, and were giving tours which enabled us to get to areas of the lighthouse not often available to visitors. The view on top is amazing, but it's the spiral staircase that I'm in love with. Simple, yet elegant. I've posted several other picture of this staircase over the years, and there are more to come. I can't help myself. Like most photographs it looks best when viewed large. Press "L" to see it that way. Other pictures I have taken here over the years can be seen in my "Old Point Loma Lighthouse set. <a href"http:www.flickr.comphotos9422878@N08sets72157628026531823">www.flickr.comphotos9422878@N08sets72157628026531823<a>

Inside The Old Point Loma Lighthouse
Taken at Cabrillo National Monument in San Diego. The best wildflowers we've had in several years because we got rain at the right times instead of our usual drought.

While walking yesterday at Cabrillo National Monument we saw the result of a successful fishing expedition. I didn't have a tripod or a long lens so this is a true grab shot and not very sharp. I'm assuming that this is a hawk or an osprey, but I'm not positive. <a href"http:bighugelabs.comonblack.php?id4357819418&sizelarge" rel"nofollow">View On Black<a>
california fish bird nature fishing sandiego hunting raptor predator osprey cabrillonationalmonument sourhterncalifornia

This was taken at Cabrillo National Monument which is on Point Loma in San Diego. It was taken late in the afternoon as the weekend sailors are headed back into the harbor as the fog starts to come in. It's hard to tell what's happening here without seeing it large. <a href"http:bighugelabs.comonblack.php?id4450560163&sizelarge" rel"nofollow">View On Black<a>

Taken at the Old Point Loma Lighthouse in Cabrillo National Monument in San Diego. I can't help myself. Every time we go there I end up photographing the spiral staircase that goes to the top. Other pictures I have taken here over the years can be seen in my "Old Point Loma Lighthouse set. <a href"http:www.flickr.comphotos9422878@N08sets72157628026531823">www.flickr.comphotos9422878@N08sets72157628026531823<a>

This was taken at the Old Point Loma Lighthouse located in Cabrillo National Monument in San Diego. This is right inside the doorway and looking straight up. I converted this to black and white use Silver Efex Pro which is software I've just started to use. Other pictures I have taken here over the years can be seen in my "Old Point Loma Lighthouse set. <a href"http:www.flickr.comphotos9422878@N08sets72157628026531823">www.flickr.comphotos9422878@N08sets72157628026531823<a> <a href"http:bighugelabs.comonblack.php?id4703314180&sizelarge" rel"nofollow">View Large On Black<a>

This is looking down from the top of the old Point Loma Lighthouse at Cabrillo National Monument. I've taken pictures here many times in the past, but this is the first time with my new wide angle lens. Aesthetically, to me, spiral staircases are very appealing. Other pictures I have taken here over the years can be seen in my "Old Point Loma Lighthouse set. <a href"http:www.flickr.comphotos9422878@N08sets72157628026531823">www.flickr.comphotos9422878@N08sets72157628026531823<a>
